doc:
Mia Hansen-Løve https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mia_Hansen-L%C3%B8ve 0 Mia Hansen-Løve (born 5 February 1981) is a French film director, screenwriter, and former actress. She has won several accolades for her work. Her first feature film, All Is Forgiven, won the Louis Delluc Prize for Best First Film in 2007 along with Céline Sciamma's Water Lilies. Hansen-Løve's film Father of My Children won the Special Jury Prize in the Un Certain Regard section at the 2009 Cannes Film Festival. In 2014, Hansen-Løve was awarded the status of Chevalier in the Ordre des Arts et des Lettres. In 2016, she won the Silver Bear for Best Director for her film Things to Come at the 66th Berlin International Film Festival, as well as becoming a member of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. Mia_Hansen-Løve ( born_5_February_1981 ) is a_French_film_director , screenwriter , and former_actress . She has_won several_accolades for her_work . Her_first_feature_film , All Is Forgiven , won the_Louis_Delluc_Prize for Best_First_Film in 2007 along with Céline_Sciamma 's_Water_Lilies . Hansen-Løve 's_film_Father of My_Children won the_Special_Jury_Prize in the_Un_Certain_Regard_section at the_2009_Cannes_Film_Festival . In 2014 , Hansen-Løve was_awarded the_status of Chevalier in the_Ordre_des_Arts_et_des_Lettres . In 2016 , she won the_Silver Bear_for_Best_Director for her_film_Things to_Come at the_66th_Berlin_International_Film_Festival , as_well_as becoming a_member of the_Academy of Motion_Picture_Arts_and_Sciences .
